definition: Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
contrast (balance of black and white in TV screen setup)/degree of contrast

sentences.english: "More than any other subject, weight is delicate, " Maddison said.
sentences.chinese: “体重问题比其他问题都要微妙，”麦迪逊说。

sentences.english: A happy family is much more important than money.
sentences.chinese: 幸福家庭比金钱更重要。

sentences.english: These arenormally sedate affairs where empty chairs outnumber the audience.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，空椅子比听众多是读书会上很平常的事。

sentences.english: China's fertility rate may be much lower than official estimates.
sentences.chinese: 中国人口高增长率可能会比政府估计的要低很多。

sentences.english: 'And it's a better hiding-place than out here in the country.
sentences.chinese: 那儿是个比乡间更好的藏身的地方。

sentences.english: Some day his pictures will be worth more than all you have in your shop.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，他的画会比你店里所有的一切还值钱。

sentences.english: It's much easier to go abroad than before.
sentences.chinese: 如今出国比以前超卓多了。

sentences.english: Who speaks words that are lovelier than those of Jesus?
sentences.chinese: 有谁说的话比耶稣更动听？

sentences.english: China was second with 32, four behind the United States.
sentences.chinese: 中国有32枚，比美国少4枚，排在第二位。

sentences.english: The horse's strides are shorter than at the other canters, without losing elasticity and cadence.
sentences.chinese: 马的步幅比其他几种跑步较短，但却不失弹性与节奏。

sentences.english: It has dignity and self-love stronger than mine.
sentences.chinese: 它的尊严与自爱比我的更强烈。

sentences.english: An airbag that deploys a second later than it should is worse than no airbag at all.
sentences.chinese: 晚一秒钟展开气囊比没有气囊的情况更糟糕。

sentences.english: It is believed that the sperm whale dives deeper than any other cetacean.
sentences.chinese: 人们相信，抹香鲸比其他鲸类动物潜得更深。

sentences.english: The exchange rate fluctuates every day.
sentences.chinese: 今天的汇率比昨天稍微低一点儿。

sentences.english: Scientists find that hard-working people live longer than average men and women.
sentences.chinese: 科学家们发现努力工作的人比一般的人更有生活。

sentences.english: This restaurant is more expensive than that one.
sentences.chinese: 这家餐馆的菜价比那家贵很多。

definition: to be on good terms/to be close friends/striving for self-improvement
to change or replace/to experience/one of the five two-hour periods into which the night was formerly divided/watch (e.g. of a sentry or guard)
like that/in that way/or so/so/so very much/about/in that case
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
not equal to/not as good as/inferior to/it would be better to
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
